speaker: MRS. USHER
line: Hi, you're reached the Usher residence, please leave a message at the tone, thank you.

speaker: MR USHER
line: Hi honey, it's about 8:30 and erm, I'm gonna be here for a while. The presentation didn't go so well, call me, I love you, bye.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Guess who I ran into from our class at Quantico? Marty Neill.

speaker: SCULLY
line: J. Edgar Jr?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Just got bumped up, Foreign Counter Intelligence, New York City Bureau, Supervisory, Special Agent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Supervisory?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: That's right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two years out of the academy, how'd he land that?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Lucked into the World Trade Center bombing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, good for Marty.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Oh, come on Dana, the guy is a loser, look where he is now. That's where we should be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Brad Wilson told me, the pyshological profile you wrote on the Washington Crossing Killer led them straight to the suspect. Word has it, you're on the Violent Crime Section's fast track.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: So how are you doing? Have you had any close encounters of the third kind?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that what everyone thinks I do?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: No, of course not. But you do work with Spooky Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder's ideas maybe a bit out there but he is a great agent.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Yeah, well, I've got this case that's, out there. Baltimore PD cops, they want our help on a serial killer profile. Three murders began six weeks ago, victims vary in age, race, gender, no known connections to each other.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I take it there's a pattern?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Point of entry. Actually, the lack of one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: One victim, college girl, killed in her ten by twelve center block dorm room. She was found with the windows locked and the door chained from the inside. The last incident, two days ago, high security office building, nothing on the security monitors, janitor spoke to the victim minutes before the murder, didn't hear or see a thing out of the ordinary.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Suicides?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Each victim was found with their liver, ripped out. No cutting tools used.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bare hands. This looks like an X-file.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Let's not get carried away. I'm gonna solve these murders but, what I would like from you is, to go over the case histories. Maybe, come down to the crime scene.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you want me to ask Mulder?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Ok, if he wants to come and do you a favor, great. But make sure he knows this is my case. Dana, if I can break a case like this one, I'll be getting my bump up the ladder. And you, maybe you won't have to be Mrs. Spooky anymore.

speaker: MULDER
line: So why didn't they ask me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're friends of mine from the academy, I'm sure they just felt more comfortable talking to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why would I make them so uncomfortable?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It probably has to do with your reputation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Reputation? I have a reputation?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, look. Colton plays by the book and you don't. They feel your methods, your theories are...

speaker: MULDER
line: Spooky? Do you think I'm spooky?

speaker: VOICE
line: Agent Scully's in here sir.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Dana, sorry I'm late.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We just got here. Er, Fox Mulder, Tom Colton.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: So, Mulder, what do you think, does this look like the work of little green men?

speaker: MULDER
line: Grey.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Grey. You said green men, a Reticulan skin tone is actually grey, they're notorious for their extraction of terrestrial human livers. Due to iron depletion in the Reticulan galaxy.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: You can't be serious.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have any idea what liver and onions go for on Reticula? `scuse me.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Dana, I've been thinking about this and I have a theory, might explain alot, tell me what you think. What if the guy enters... Hold on a second. What in the hell's he doing? Err, that vent is six inches by about eighteen, even if a Reticulan could crawl through, it's screwed in place.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is the print I took yesterday from Usher's office, these others are from an X-file. Ten murders, Baltimore area, undetermined points of entry, each victim had their liver removed. These prints were discovered at five of the ten crime scenes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ten murders, Colton never mentioned..

speaker: MULDER
line: Most likely, he's not aware of them. These two prints were lifted five years before he was born at Powhatan Mill. And these three were lifted probably, five years before his mother was even born.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you saying, these prints are from the 1960's and the 1930's?

speaker: MULDER
line: And fingerprinting was just coming into it's own in 1903, but there was a murder involving an extracted liver.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Of course.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now that's five murders every thirty years. That makes two more to go this year.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're saying these are copy-cats.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did we learn in our first day at the academy, Scully? Each fingerprint is unique, these are a perfect match.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you suggesting that I go before the Violent Crime Section and present a profile declaring that these murders were done by aliens?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, of course not, I find no evidence of alien involvement.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what then? That, that this is the work of a hundred year old serial killer who is capable of overpowering a healthy six foot two businessman.

speaker: MULDER
line: And he should stick out in a crowd with ten inch fingers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, bottom line, this is Colton's case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Our X-file dates back to 1903, we had it first.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, they don't want you involved. They don't want to hear your theories. That's why Blevins has you hidden away down here.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're down here too. Look, why don't we agree to this, they'll have their investigation, we'll have ours and never the twain shall meet. Agreed?

speaker: FULLER
line: Good job, Agent Scully. If there are no objections, I'd like to begin our stakeouts of the murder sites tonight. We're looking for a male, twenty-five to thirty-five, possibly wearing a uniform, gas company, UPS, whatever. I know you're assigned to another area Scully, but if you don't mind some overtime, you're welcome to come aboard with us, on this. Erm, that is if you don't mind working in an area that's a bit more down-to-earth.

speaker: WALKIE-TALKIE
line: Position ten, do you check?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Position ten, I copy.

speaker: MULDER
line: You wouldn't shoot an unarmed man, would ya copper?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what the hell are you doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's not coming back here, his thrill is derived from the challenge of unseemingly impossible entry. He's already beaten this place, if you'd read the X-file on the case, you'd come to the same conclusion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you are jeopardising my stakeout.

speaker: MULDER
line: Seeds? You're wasting your time, I'm going home. Scully, call for backup and get over here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Position ten requesting backup.

speaker: MULDER
line: In there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Federal Agent, I'm armed. Proceed down the vent, slowly.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Take `im.

speaker: AGENT
line: Alright, move, move, move.

speaker: AGENT 2
line: FBI.

speaker: AGENT
line: Don't move, don't move, get your hands up, keep `em up.

speaker: AGENT 2
line: You're under arrest. You have the right to remain silent..

speaker: MULDER
line: You were right.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Is your full name, Eugene Victor Tooms?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: Yes.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Are you a resident of the state of Maryland?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: Yes.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Are you an employee of the Baltimore Municipal Animal Control?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: Yes.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Is it your intent to lie to me about anything here, today?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: No.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Were you ever enrolled in college?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: Yes.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Were you ever enrolled in medical school?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: No.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Have you ever removed a liver from a human being?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: No.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Have you ever killed a living creature?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: Yes.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Have you ever killed a human being?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: No.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Were you ever in George Usher's office?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: No.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Did you kill George Usher?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: No.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Are you over one hundred years old?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: That must be a control question.

speaker: MULDER
line: I had her ask it.

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: No.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Have you ever been to Powhatan Mill?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: Yes.

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: No.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: Are you afraid you might fail this test?

speaker: EUGENE TOOMS
line: Well, yes, because I didn't do anything.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: He nailed it, A plus, as far as I'm concerned, the subject did not kill those two people.

speaker: FULLER
line: Maintenance people at the office building, confirm the call to animal control regarding a bad smell. They found a dead cat, in the ventilation ducts on the second floor.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Well, that's that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It still doesn't explain what he was doing there that late at night.

speaker: FULLER
line: So, he's one of the few civil servants we have with initiative, and we busted him for it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was crawling up an air duct, by himself, without alerting security.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Dana, he passed the test, his story checks out, he's not the guy. It doesn't mean that your profile's incorrect.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully's right, it is the guy.

speaker: FULLER
line: Whatta you got, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: He lied on questions eleven and thirteen, his electrodermal and cardiographic response nearly go off the chart.

speaker: FULLER
line: Is number eleven, the hundred year old question? Well, let me tell ye, I had a reaction to that stupid question. And what the hell is this Powhatan Mill thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Two murders with matching mo's occurred in Powhatan Mill in 1933, just look at the chart.

speaker: EXAMINER
line: My interpretation of those reactions..

speaker: FULLER
line: I don't need you or that machine, telling me if Tooms was alive in `33.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's the guy.

speaker: FULLER
line: I'm letting him go.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: You comin'?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tom, I wanna thank you for letting me put in some time with the VCS, but I am officially assigned to the X-files.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: I'll see what I can do about that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tom, I can look out for myself.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: You said Mulder was out there, that guy's insane.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You knew they wouldn't believe you, why did you push it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe I thought you caught the right guy. And maybe I run into so many people, who are hostile, just because they can't open their minds to the possibilties, that sometimes the need to mess with their heads, outweighs the millstone of humiliation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It seems like you were acting very territorial, I don't know, forget it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Of course I was, in our investigations, you may not always agree with me but at least you respect the journey. And if you wanna continue working with them, I won't hold it against ye.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Er, I don't know, you must have something more than your polygraph interpretation to backup this bizarre theory and I have to see what it is.

speaker: MULDER
line: These are Eugene Tooms' prints. This is the fingerprint they took from Usher's office, it matches the old ones from the X-files. Obviously no match, but what if, somehow...

speaker: SCULLY
line: How could that be?

speaker: MULDER
line: Only thing I know for certain is, they let him go.

speaker: FULLER
line: Sixty-four inches from the south wall.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Let's run a check on liver transplants in the next twenty-four hours, maybe this thing is black market.

speaker: FULLER
line: C'mon, it was ripped outta there.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Look at this point, I'm willing to give any theory a shot. Any sane theory, I'm sorry Dana but I only want qualified members of the investigating team at the crime scene.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's the matter Colton, you worried I'm gonna solve your case?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tom. We have authorized access to this crime scene. A report of you obstructing another officer's investigation might stick out on your personnel file.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: Look Dana, whose side are you on?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The victim's.

speaker: FULLER
line: A hundred and five inches from the fireplace.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The victim is a Thomas Werner, single, white..

speaker: MULDER
line: It's Tooms. And he took something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Baltimore PD checked out Tooms' apartment, it was a cover. No one has ever lived there and he hasn't shown up for work since he was arrested.

speaker: MULDER
line: I found him. How do we learn about the present, we look to the past. I think this is where it all began in 1903 on Exeter Street. Now look at the address of that first murder in 1903.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Apartment 2 0 3. He killed the guy above him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe, his neighbour played the victrola too loud.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, this must be Tooms' great grandfather.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about the prints?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Genetics might explain the patterns, it also might explain the sociopathic attitudes and behaviours. It begins with one family member, who raises an offspring, who raises the next child.

speaker: MULDER
line: So what is this, the Anti-Waltons.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what do you think?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think what we have to do is track Eugene Tooms, there's four down and one to go this year. If we don't get him right now, the next chance is in year.....

speaker: MULDER
line: And you're gonna be head of the bureau by then. So I think you have to go through the census, I'm gonna plough through this century's marriage, birth, death certificates, and... You have any dramamine on you by any chance cos, these things make me seasick. Anything?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nope, he disappeared off the face of the earth. You?

speaker: MULDER
line: Never was born, never married, never died.

speaker: SCULLY
line: At least in Baltimore County. No, I did find one thing though, erm, it's the current address of the investigating officer at the Powhatan Mill murders in 1933.

speaker: FRANK BRIGGS
line: I've waited twenty-five years for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: FRANK BRIGGS
line: I called it quits, in 1968 after, fourty-five years as a cop. And those killings at Powhatan Mill. I was a sheriif then and, er, I'd seen my share of murders, bloody ones. But I could go home and, pitch a few baseballs to my kid and never give it a second thought, you gotta be able to do that. You'd go crazy, right. But those murders in Powhatan Mill, when I walked into that room, my heart, went cold, my hands, numbed. I could feel, IT.

speaker: MULDER
line: Feel what, Frank?

speaker: FRANK BRIGGS
line: When I first heard about the death camps in 1945, I remembered Powhatan Mill. When I see the kurds and the bosnians, that room is there, I tell ye. It's like all the horrible acts that humans are capable of, somehow, gave birth to some kind of, human monster. That's why I say I've been waiting for you. Aah, there's a box in the trunk here, get it for me, would you please. Now this, is all the evidence I've collected, officially and unofficially.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unofficially?

speaker: FRANK BRIGGS
line: I knew the murders in `63 were by the same, person as in `33. But by then, they had me on a desk, pushing papers and they wouldn't let me anywhere near the case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A piece of the removed liver?

speaker: FRANK BRIGGS
line: Yes, but you know, that's not the only trophy he took with him. Family members reported small personal affects missing in each case. A hairbrush in the Walters murder, a coffee mug in the Taylor murder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you ever heard the name, Eugene Victor Tooms?

speaker: FRANK BRIGGS
line: Humh, when they wouldn't bring me aboard in `63 I, I did some of my own work. I took, these surveillance pictures, this, is Tooms. Course, that was him thirty years ago. And this, is the apartment where he lived. It was located at..

speaker: MULDER
line: 66 Exeter Street?

speaker: FRANK BRIGGS
line: Right. That's it, right there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Here's 103.

speaker: MULDER
line: The old man was right, you can feel it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's nothing here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Check this out. What's down here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. Let's find out. Just an old coal cellar.

speaker: MULDER
line: Somebody having a garage sale. This is the shape of Werner's mantel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Frank said he collected trophies.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does he live in here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It looks like the wall's deteriorating.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, somebody made it. This is a nest, look, it's made out of rags and newspapers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This looks like the opening, think there's anything inside? Oh my God, Mulder, it's smells like, I think it's bile.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there any way I can get it off my fingers quickly without betraying my cool exterior?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No one could live in this.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think it's where he lives, I think it's where he hibernates.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hibernates?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just listen, what if some genetic mutation could allow a man to awaken every thirty years.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: And what if the five livers could provide him sustenance for that period. What if Tooms is some kind of, twentieth century, genetic mutant.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In any case, he's not here now and he's gotta come back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well we're gonna need a surveillance team.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, that'll take some fannagling.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well you go down town and see what you can fannagle, I'll keep watch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, wait, I'm snagged on something, oh, it's ok, I got it.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's about time.

speaker: KENNEDY
line: So, who're we looking for again?

speaker: MULDER
line: Eugene Tooms, he's unarmed but consider him dangerous. Scully and I'll be back to relieve you in eight hours if he doesn't show, right here.

speaker: KRAMER
line: You got it, Spooky.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: We have to talk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to meet Mulder..

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: That's what we have to talk about. You're using two of my men to sit in front of a building that's been condemned for ten years?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It isn't in any way interferring with your investigation.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: When we first had lunch, I really looked forward to working with you, you were a good agent, but now after Mulder, I couldn't have you far enough away. Don't bother going down there, I had the stakeout called off.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can't do that.

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: No, I can't but my regional asat can, especially after I told them about the irresponsible waste in man hours. Auh-uh! Let me call Mulder, let me tell him the news.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this what it takes to climb the ladder Colton?

speaker: TOM COLTON
line: All the way to the top.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then I can't wait `til you fall off and land on your ass. This is Fox Mulder, I'm not here, leave a message.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is everyone? Scully? This is Fox Mulder, I'm not here, leave a message.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you must've gone out since Colton gave us the night off, I say we file a complaint against him, I am furious. Call me when you get in, ok, bye.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dammit.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dammit, ANSWER.

speaker: MULDER
line: SCULLY! You alright? He's not gonna get his quota this year.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at him, he's building another nest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You'll be interested to know that I've ordered some genetic tests. The preliminary medical exam revealed quite abnormal development in the muscular and skeletal systems, as well as a continually declining metabolic rate. It dips way below the levels registered in deep sleep. Did you hear what I said Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: All these people putting bars on their windows, spending good money on hi-tech security systems, trying to feel safe. I look at this guy and I think, "It ain't enough".
